author: 最视频
title: 印度279死致命空难原因有新进展！机长关闭燃油开关可能是坠机直接原因！
text: 记者当地时间7月16日获悉，美方初步调查评估消息称，印度航空失事航班的黑匣子录音显示，机长关闭了控制两台引擎燃油供应的开关，这可能是导致坠机的直接原因。 来源：闪电新闻 编辑：李聪 责编：刘抒音 审校：张洁 主编：崔维莉

author: Zonebourse
title: La grève chez Boeing pose un défi aux objectifs de production du MAX et à la chaîne d'approvisionnement, selon le directeur financier de l'entreprise - Zonebourse
text:
Le directeur financier de Boeing, Brian West, a déclaré vendredi que la grève entamée vendredi par plus de 30 000 ouvriers des usines de la côte ouest des Etats-Unis compliquera la réalisation de l'objectif de production du 737 MAX et la stabilisation de la chaîne d'approvisionnement du constructeur aéronautique. M. West a également déclaré lors de la conférence Morgan Stanley Laguna qu'il s'attendait à ce que les marges du troisième trimestre de l'unité de défense et d'espace de l'entreprise soient négatives, comme celles du deuxième trimestre.
Les travailleurs de Seattle et de Portland, dans l'Oregon, qui produisent le MAX et d'autres avions à réaction ont débrayé après avoir rejeté massivement un accord contractuel en raison de demandes d'augmentation de salaire. Cette première grève des travailleurs depuis 2008 intervient alors que Boeing fait l'objet d'un examen minutieux de la part des autorités de régulation américaines et de ses clients depuis qu'un panneau de porte s'est détaché d'un 737 MAX en plein vol en janvier.
M. West a déclaré que Boeing avait fait des progrès en vue d'augmenter la production de son avion le plus vendu pour atteindre 38 exemplaires par mois d'ici la fin de l'année, malgré le scepticisme des agences de notation à l'égard de cet objectif.
"Nous avons bien progressé dans la stabilisation de la production et dans la préparation des 38 avions par mois d'ici la fin de l'année. Maintenant, il est évident que cela va prendre plus de temps", a déclaré M. West.
M. West n'a toutefois pas voulu commenter les détails de l'objectif, qui dépend de la durée de la grève.
La grève crée davantage d'incertitude et d'inquiétude pour les fournisseurs de pièces et de composants destinés à des programmes tels que le 737 MAX. Nombre d'entre eux éprouvaient déjà des difficultés à planifier leur production en raison des modifications répétées apportées par Boeing aux prévisions internes destinées aux fournisseurs.
M. West a déclaré que l'une des priorités de l'entreprise était de stabiliser sa chaîne d'approvisionnement, mais que cet "objectif devenait de plus en plus difficile à atteindre".
M. West a suggéré que Boeing cesse de prendre des pièces auprès de certains fournisseurs pour les programmes touchés par la grève et pour lesquels l'avionneur dispose de stocks suffisants. Le gros porteur 787 n'est pas concerné, car il est construit en Caroline du Sud par une main-d'œuvre non syndiquée.
Interrogé sur la chaîne d'approvisionnement, M. West a déclaré que pour les programmes autres que le 787, si le fournisseur n'est pas en retard et que l'entreprise dispose d'un stock suffisant, "vous savez, ne livrez plus".
Il a ajouté que ce message était diffusé "du jour au lendemain et au moment même où nous parlons".

author: Matt Moret
title: Denver police fire three officers who referred to immigrant shelter visits as ‘target practice’
text:
The Denver Police Department confirmed Thursday that it fired three officers in July after it “learned of disturbing messages” exchanged in a group chat among officers who attended the department’s training academy together.
According to a police spokesperson, the officers joked about going to shelters serving new immigrants for “target practice.”
Department officials heard about the messages on April 4, 2024, six days after the officers sent them. An investigation began immediately.
“Due to the abhorrent nature of the messages, the officers, who were still in the probationary phase of employment following their graduation from the Denver Police Academy, were terminated from the Denver Police Department as of July 22, 2024,” a DPD spokesperson said in a statement.
The three fired officers are
Rodrigo Basurto, Meagan Joy and Scot Persichette.
DPD did not name any other members of the group chat, but it said the remaining officers will get additional equity, diversity and inclusivity training. They’ll also undergo additional Active Bystandership for Law Enforcement (ABLE) training.
“The Denver Police Department is appalled by the subject of the messages, which are contradictory to the mission and values of the Department, and disrespect not only newcomers and our community, but also every other officer working to keep everyone in our community safe,” the agency’s statement said.
All three terminated officers were reported to the Colorado Peace Officer Standards and Training (POST) body, which sets rules for the certification of every peace officer in Colorado. As part of the Colorado Attorney General’s Office, the unit also investigates violations of its certification standards.

author: Jerzy Lewandowski
title: Turkey Advances in Drone Warfare with Maiden Flight of Anka 3 UAV
text:
Turkey Advances in Drone Warfare with Maiden Flight of Anka 3 UAV
Turkey has marked a new era in its aerial combat capabilities with the first successful test flight of its most advanced unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) to date, the Anka 3. This inaugural flight signifies Turkey’s ongoing dedication to bolstering its self-sufficiency in defense technologies. Producing such a sophisticated drone is a clear indicator of Turkey’s growing expertise and innovation in military drone technology.
The Anka 3 UAV, developed by the Turkish Aerospace Industries, is a ‘flying wing’ drone, notable for its stealth capabilities, high-performance jet engine, and versatile payload options. These attributes equip the UAV for an array of critical missions, further cementing Turkey’s position as a notable player in defense technology on the international stage.
During its impressive debut, the Anka 3 ascended to a notable altitude, demonstrating substantial speed and undertaking several testing maneuvers without a hitch. With a design that excludes traditional tail sections, the UAV is optimized for stealth operations, significantly reducing its radar signature.
Looking ahead, the Anka 3 promises a high service ceiling, considerable endurance, and a significant payload, allowing for a variety of munitions and sensors to be equipped. Its successful test flight is more than just a testament to Turkish engineering; it represents a strategic enhancement to Turkey’s military capacities, with wide-ranging implications for national defense and potential export contributions to global allies.
FAQ Section
What is the Anka 3 UAV?
The Anka 3 UAV is Turkey’s most advanced unmanned aerial vehicle to date, characterized by its ‘flying wing’ design, which contributes to its stealth capabilities. It also features a high-performance jet engine and can carry versatile payloads.
What are the capabilities of the Anka 3 UAV?
The Anka 3 boasts stealth capabilities due to its reduced radar signature, a high service ceiling, substantial endurance, and the ability to carry a variety of munitions and sensors.
What does the successful test flight of Anka 3 signify for Turkey?
The successful test flight demonstrates Turkey’s advancements and self-sufficiency in defense technology. It also underscores Turkey’s growing expertise in military drone innovation and its potential impact on international defense technology.
Who developed the Anka 3 UAV?
The Anka 3 UAV was developed by Turkish Aerospace Industries, a major player in Turkey’s aerospace and defense sector.
How is the ‘flying wing’ design beneficial?
The ‘flying wing’ design of the Anka 3 minimizes the radar cross-section, making it harder to detect with radar, which is advantageous for stealth operations.
What does the future hold for the Anka 3 UAV?
The Anka 3 is expected to serve in a variety of critical mission roles for Turkey’s national defense, with the possibility of contributing to defense exports to global allies.
Key Terms and Definitions
– UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle): An aircraft piloted by remote control or onboard computers, commonly referred to as a drone.
– Stealth Capabilities: Features that make aircraft less visible to radar and other detection methods.
– Flying Wing: An aircraft design that lacks a distinct fuselage and tail, wherein the wings form the main body of the craft.
– Radar Signature: The characteristic pattern that an object presents to radar, used for its detection and identification.
– Service Ceiling: The maximum altitude at which an aircraft can sustainably operate.
– Endurance: The length of time an aircraft can remain in the air without refueling.
– Payload: The carrying capacity of an aircraft, including weapons, sensors, and other equipment.
Suggested Related Links
–
Turkish Aerospace Industries
–
Presidency of Defence Industries of Turkey
Please note that the URLs provided are based on the assumption that they reflect the main domains for Turkish Aerospace Industries and the Presidency of Defence Industries of Turkey, at the time of writing. Please ensure to check for the most up-to-date and accurate URLs when visiting these sites.
Jerzy Lewandowski, a visionary in the realm of virtual reality and augmented reality technologies, has made significant contributions to the field with his pioneering research and innovative designs. His work primarily focuses on enhancing user experience and interaction within virtual environments, pushing the boundaries of immersive technology. Lewandowski’s groundbreaking projects have gained recognition for their ability to merge the digital and physical worlds, offering new possibilities in gaming, education, and professional training. His expertise and forward-thinking approach mark him as a key influencer in shaping the future of virtual and augmented reality applications.

author: Sport Witness
title: Everton reach agreement with Lyon for transfer of Ernest Nuamah - Sport Witness
text:
Everton’s attempts to sign Ernest Nuamah from Lyon had gone quiet over the past 24 hours or so, but it appears that just meant the Premier League club were working on reaching an agreement behind the scenes.
David Moyes needs an addition in attack and with the Italian media insistent every day that Beto wants to depart Goodison Park for a return to Serie A, the need is perhaps even greater than it would have otherwise been.
RMC report on Thursday evening that Everton have come to an agreement with Lyon for Ernest Nuamah’s transfer in this window.
According to the reliable French source the two clubs have reached an agreement for around €20m, so the forward would be moving on a permanent transfer.
Now that an agreement between the clubs has been reached, Everton are in negotiations with the player over his salary and general contract.
RMC say there’s confidence of an agreement being found between Everton and Ernest Nuamah, and this is a transfer which will now be expected to go through.

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Virginia Ushers in a Zero-Emission Future with the Advanced Clean Cars II Rule
text:
In a groundbreaking move poised to dramatically alter the automotive landscape, Virginia has announced the adoption of the Advanced Clean Cars II Rule, a bold initiative mandating that by 2035, all new vehicles sold within the state must be zero-emission. This pivotal decision underscores Virginia's commitment to confronting climate change head-on, targeting the transportation sector—the state's leading source of greenhouse gas emissions. With the rule slated for implementation on March 13, the clock is ticking for carmakers to pivot towards eco-friendly production practices, marking a significant step towards a sustainable future.
Driving Towards a Greener Horizon
The Advanced Clean Cars II Rule isn't just about reducing tailpipe emissions; it's a comprehensive strategy aimed at overhauling Virginia's transportation ecosystem. By compelling carmakers to shift their focus to electric vehicles (EVs), the state is laying the groundwork for a cleaner environment and public health benefits. Projections suggest that the rule could save the state billions in healthcare costs by mitigating pollution-related ailments. This ambitious regulation emerges amid a backdrop of political contention, with some legislators, particularly from the Republican camp, opposing the move based on concerns tied to California's emissions standards, which Virginia's new rule mirrors. Despite these challenges, the rule stands as a testament to Virginia's dedication to leading the charge against climate change.
Powering the Future: Challenges and Solutions
As Virginia prepares to transition to an electric vehicle-dominated roadscape, questions surrounding the adequacy of the existing energy infrastructure have surfaced. Dominion Energy, a key player in the state's electric grid development, has been at the forefront of efforts to enhance Virginia's electric car infrastructure. The goal is to ensure that the grid can withstand the increased demand for electric vehicle charging, a critical component in the success of the Advanced Clean Cars II Rule. While concerns persist, experts remain optimistic that with strategic investments and upgrades, the energy infrastructure will be capable of supporting the anticipated surge in electric vehicles, facilitating a smooth transition to a zero-emission future.
A Milestone in Climate Action
The journey towards achieving a 43% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions in the transportation sector by 2030 is ambitious. Yet, the Advanced Clean Cars II Rule represents a significant milestone in this quest. It embodies Virginia's resolve to combat climate change, not only through policy but also by fostering a culture of sustainability and innovation. As the state gears up for the rule's implementation, the narrative extends beyond the borders of Virginia, signaling a broader shift towards environmental stewardship and sustainable mobility on a national scale.
In essence, the adoption of the Advanced Clean Cars II Rule by Virginia marks a pivotal moment in the ongoing battle against climate change. By mandating the sale of only zero-emission vehicles by 2035, the state not only sets a new standard for environmental policy but also charts a course towards a cleaner, healthier future. This bold initiative reflects a harmonious blend of ambition, foresight, and responsibility, offering a blueprint for others to follow. As Virginia embarks on this transformative journey, the eyes of the nation—and indeed, the world—will be watching, eagerly anticipating the ripple effects of this landmark decision on the global fight against climate change.

author: John Asbury
title: Long Island Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence, Suffolk officials highlight dangers of substance abuse during the holidays
text:
[Long Island](/long-island)
Long Island Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence, Suffolk officials highlight dangers of substance abuse during the holidays
Paulette Phillippe’s grandson Gabriel had his first drug overdose three days after Christmas.
The 15-year-old loved Christmas, but that year, she said, he seemed down during the holiday season. She suggested they have a quieter celebration but he begged her to get a tree, she recalled.
"He loved the holidays," said the Mattituck resident, 79. "He always picked out a tree and it had to have a star, because the star lit the way."
It would be his last Christmas. The Rocky Point teen died of a fentanyl overdose on April 22, 2010.
GET HELP
- The Long Island Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence, based in Westbury, runs a 24-hour hotline for anyone struggling with addiction at 631-979-1700.
- The Long Island Crisis Center in Bellmore also offers a 24-hour hotline at 516-227-TALK (8255).
On Thursday, Phillippe — holding photos of her grandson — joined other members of the nonprofit Long Island Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence and Suffolk officials at a news conference in Hauppauge to highlight the dangers of substance abuse and addiction during the holidays.
Anthony Rizzuto, founder of the Long Island group Families in Support of Treatment, said that 10-14% of the population will suffer from some form of addiction and substance abuse. Officials encouraged anyone dealing with grief or anxiety during the holidays to seek help.
"It is the season of peace and joy and family," said the council's executive director, Steve Chassman. "It is also a time for depression and for self-medication. It is a time of loneliness, and it's a time to let individuals and families know that although we understand self-medication in the form of substance use, this is also a high-risk time for residents across Suffolk County and Long Island."
Chassman said recovery is possible, noting there are 28 million Americans living in recovery from addiction.
Suffolk County Executive Ed Romaine said the county was working with the council to let anyone struggling during the holidays know that help is available. He also emphasized that anyone drinking or using drugs should not put others at risk by getting behind the wheel.
"You should not have to face life's challenges alone," Romaine said. "And if you are, consider reaching out, because we're particularly concerned about people who would drink and drive or drug and drive. We want everyone to be safe on our roads, and we want everyone to be the best they can be in life."
District Attorney Raymond Tierney said his office would seek to help those battling addiction by cracking down on people who sell illegal substances like fentanyl and other opioids.
"I will also send a message out to those who would seek to prey upon the vulnerabilities and the weaknesses of others," he said. "If you are thinking about peddling this poison to your fellow residents of Suffolk County, you will be held responsible for that."
Help across the Island
Nassau County officials are also doing their part to help those struggling with addiction during the holidays.
County Executive Bruce Blakeman said Nassau has issued public service announcements and police will increase patrols to look for impaired drivers.
"There’s a lot of different reasons why there is a spike every holiday season," he said. "We work with our mental health experts and police to offer a wide range of services and we’re going to continue to spend a lot on mental health."
As for Phillippe, she said that even though it sometimes hurts to celebrate, she tries to honor her grandson's memory with Christmas traditions such as raising a star on her tree.
“Whatever makes him come alive," she said.
No bail for alleged CEO killer ... Suffolk cop back on duty ... Trader Joe's plans new LI store ... All LI football team

author: Zacks Investment Research
title: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) Laps the Stock Market: Here's Why - December 28, 2023 - Zacks.com
text:
The most recent trading session ended with Johnson & Johnson ( JNJ Quick Quote JNJ - Free Report ) standing at $156.58, reflecting a +0.15% shift from the previouse trading day's closing. This move outpaced the S&P 500's daily gain of 0.04%. At the same time, the Dow added 0.14%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq lost 0.03%.
Shares of the world's biggest maker of health care products witnessed a gain of 2.79% over the previous month, trailing the performance of the Medical sector with its gain of 5.57% and the S&P 500's gain of 5.28%.
The investment community will be closely monitoring the performance of Johnson & Johnson in its forthcoming earnings report. The company is scheduled to release its earnings on January 23, 2024. The company is expected to report EPS of $2.32, down 1.28% from the prior-year quarter. Alongside, our most recent consensus estimate is anticipating revenue of $20.91 billion, indicating a 11.79% downward movement from the same quarter last year.
For the entire fiscal year, the Zacks Consensus Estimates are projecting earnings of $9.99 per share and a revenue of $84.67 billion, representing changes of -1.58% and -10.82%, respectively, from the prior year.
It's also important for investors to be aware of any recent modifications to analyst estimates for Johnson & Johnson. These revisions typically reflect the latest short-term business trends, which can change frequently. With this in mind, we can consider positive estimate revisions a sign of optimism about the company's business outlook.
Our research demonstrates that these adjustments in estimates directly associate with imminent stock price performance. To take advantage of this, we've established the Zacks Rank, an exclusive model that considers these estimated changes and delivers an operational rating system.
The Zacks Rank system, running from #1 (Strong Buy) to #5 (Strong Sell), holds an admirable track record of superior performance, independently audited, with #1 stocks contributing an average annual return of +25% since 1988. Within the past 30 days, our consensus EPS projection has moved 1.41% lower. Currently, Johnson & Johnson is carrying a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).
With respect to valuation, Johnson & Johnson is currently being traded at a Forward P/E ratio of 15.65. This indicates no noticeable deviation in contrast to its industry's Forward P/E of 15.65.
One should further note that JNJ currently holds a PEG ratio of 3.19. The PEG ratio is similar to the widely-used P/E ratio, but this metric also takes the company's expected earnings growth rate into account. Large Cap Pharmaceuticals stocks are, on average, holding a PEG ratio of 2.67 based on yesterday's closing prices.
The Large Cap Pharmaceuticals industry is part of the Medical sector. This industry, currently bearing a Zacks Industry Rank of 74, finds itself in the top 30% echelons of all 250+ industries.
The Zacks Industry Rank assesses the vigor of our specific industry groups by computing the average Zacks Rank of the individual stocks incorporated in the groups. Our research shows that the top 50% rated industries outperform the bottom half by a factor of 2 to 1.
Be sure to follow all of these stock-moving metrics, and many more, on Zacks.com.

author: Marissa Blackwood
title: West Ham United Defeats Arsenal 2-0 in Premier League Match, Arsenal Misses Opportunity to Retake First Place
text:
West Ham United 2-0 Arsenal (Dec 28, 2023) Game Analysis
Efficient Defense and Clinical Finishing Lead West Ham to Victory
West Ham United’s resolute defense and clinical finishing proved to be the difference as they secured a 2-0 victory over Arsenal. Despite having only three efforts on target, West Ham capitalized on their opportunities, with Tomas Soucek and Konstantinos Mavropanos finding the back of the net. The efficient display highlighted the importance of capitalizing on limited chances in a competitive league.
Arsenal’s Struggles in Front of Goal Raise Doubts
Arsenal’s failure to convert their chances into goals once again raised doubts about their title credentials. Despite having more than twice as many opportunities as their opponents, Arsenal’s inability to find the back of the net proved costly. Manager Mikel Arteta expressed his disappointment, emphasizing the need for his team to be more clinical in front of goal.
David Moyes Secures Landmark Victory at Arsenal
West Ham’s victory marked a historic moment for manager David Moyes, who secured his first-ever league win at Arsenal in 22 attempts. The milestone victory highlighted West Ham’s progress under Moyes’ leadership and their ability to compete with the top teams in the league.

organizations.name: arsenal misses opportunity to retake first place west ham united
